page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Several minor earthworks are visible in the area. In{East {Torrington}the undulations marking the site of the former village are clearly visible in the field immediately north west of the church. In{West Torrington also,a field, surrounded by roads or footpaths, shows the sunken tracks of former roads and the raised house platforms of the earlier village. The modern village is mainly on the west of this site. In{Bleasby }there is a very small motte,surrounded by a ditch, and now covered by trees. At{Collow,}just across the beck from East Torrington, is the moated site of Collow Abbey, now occupied by a farm. {St.Gilbert of Sempringham}once held the living of West Torrington.
